intro: Gymnanthes pavoniana, commonly known as the golden star tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, dark bark and large, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by orange-red berries containing a single seed. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage and unique fruit. The tree is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
